label: ZW175
info_overview:
Aeotec Smart Switch 7 (SS7) has been crafted to power connected lighting using SmartStart, S2 framework, and Z-Wave Plus. It is powered by Aeotec’s S2 technology. 

  • Smart Switch 7 is intended for indoor use in dry locations only. Do not use in damp, moist, and/or wet locations.
  • Max-amperage: 15 amps for ZW175-A
  • May-amperage: 10 amps for ZW175-C
info_inclusion:
Getting your Smart Switch up and running is as simple as plugging it into a wall socket and adding it to your Z-Wave network.

  1. Set your Z-Wave Controller into its 'Add Device' mode in order to add the product into your Z-Wave system. Refer to the Controller's manual if you are unsure of how to perform this step.
  2. Power your Smart Switch 7 to any outlet; its LED will be breathing a blue light if it is ready to be paired.
  3. Click Action Button 2 times slowly to set your Smart Switch 7 into pair mode.
  4. If your Z-Wave Controller supports S2 encryption, enter the first 5 digits of DSK into your Controller's interface if it is requested. The DSK is printed on its Smart Switch 7.
    a) If pairing succeeds, it will become a bright blue light for 2 seconds. Smart Switch 7 is now a part of your Z-Wave home control system. You can configure it and its automation via your Z-Wave system; please refer to your software's user guide for precise instructions.
    b) If pairing fails, it will light a solid bright red light for 2 seconds and then return to a breathing blue light; repeat steps 1 to 4 if this happens.
info_exclusion:
Your Smart Switch can be removed from your Z-Wave network at any time. You’ll need to use your Z-Wave network’s main controller to do this and the following instructions will tell you how to do this using Aeotec by Aeon Labs’ Z-Stick or Minimote controller.

If you are using other products as your main Z-Wave controller, please refer to the part of their respective manuals that tells you how to remove devices from your network.

If you're using an existing gateway:

  1. Set your Z-Wave Controller into its 'Remove Device' / 'Unpair Device' mode in order to remove the product from your Z-Wave system. Refer to the Controller's manual if you are unsure of how to perform this step.
  2. Make sure the product is powered. If not, plug it into a wall socket and power it on.
  3. Click Action Button 2 times quickly; it will bright violet light up to 2s.
    a. If Removing fails, it will bright red light for 2 seconds and then turn back to Load Indicator Mode; repeat steps 1 to 3. Contact us for further support if needed.
    b. If Removing succeeds, it will become breathing blue light. Smart Switch 7 is removed from the Z-Wave network successfully and is ready to be paired again.
info_usage:
Button Presses and LED reaction.

Button Press Function when released. LED Reaction
Power On (Unpaired from the network).

(Paired into the network).		 Breathes blue.

LED follows the state of load (configurable).
QR Code Scan Pairs into Z-Wave network. Blue fast blink during pairing, then solid blue for 2 seconds to indicate success.
Tap or Click
Controls load state.

 LED Follows load control state.
Press 2 times slowly Enters pair mode. Blue fast blink, after first Click Red and after second Click Orange.

The LED change to Green, if the device paired
Press 2 times fastly Enters unpair mode After press 2 times the led indicate purple.

After inclusion, the LED flashes Blue
Press 3 times Disable the Alarm Response LED stops flash
Press and hold for 2 to 5 seconds. Toggles LED display mode when SS7 is paired. Yellow LED
  • Enabled - LED follows ON/OFF state.
  • Disabled - LED is disabled
Press and hold for 5 to 10 seconds. Test communication quality Indicator Light will become cyan light when press, and quickly flash cyan light when release, indicating start to test communication quality between the product and Node 1.

At the end of the test, Indicator Light will display the colour according to the communication quality.

Good = green light for 2s.

General = yellow light for 2s.

Poor = red light for 2s.
Press and hold for 10 to 15 seconds. Reset overload alarm and over current Alarm Red LED flashes
Press and hold for 15 to 20 seconds. Stay in Z-Wave network, but factory resets all settings back to default. Red LED Flashes faster.
Press and hold for 20 seconds and more. Completely factory reset and remove from Z-Wave network. Breathes Blue.

        Set the response of the switch in response to an operation performed when an alarm is received.<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 3, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": "No Action" }, { "value": 1, "label": "Turn switch off" }, { "value": 2, "label": "Turn switch on" }, { "value": 3, "label": "Turn the switch on and off" } ] }, { "id": 9, "label": "Alarm reaction when received", "description": "Configure what alarms Smart Switch 7 will react to from other Z-Wave devices.", "overview": "
        Value<\/strong><\/td> Description<\/strong><\/td> <\/tr>
        0<\/td> The alarm will be triggered by open state, and be disabled by closed state.<\/td> <\/tr>
        1<\/td> The alarm will be triggered by closed state, and be disabled by open state.<\/td> <\/tr>
        256<\/td> Smoke alarm.<\/td> <\/tr>
        512<\/td> CO Alarm<\/td> <\/tr>
        1024<\/td> CO2 Alarm<\/td> <\/tr>
        2048<\/td> Heat Alarm<\/td> <\/tr>
        4096<\/td> Water Alarm<\/td> <\/tr>
        8192<\/td> Access Control<\/td> <\/tr>
        16384<\/td> Home Security<\/td> <\/tr><\/table>

        Value 0 and 1 cannot be used at the same time, choose one as a part of your calculation.<\/p>

        Use the sum of values to determine what alarms trigger your Smart Switch 7.<\/p>

        For example:<\/p>

        Value = 0 + 256 + 512 + 1024 = 1792
        0 = sets the control scheme to turn on Smart Switch 7 when open alarm state happens<\/p>

        256 = allows Smoke Alarm signals to control SS7<\/p>

        512 = allows CO Alarm signals to control SS7<\/p>

        1024 = allows CO2 Alarm signals to control SS7<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 16384, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": "Trigger open, disabled closed" }, { "value": 1, "label": "Trigger closed, disabled open" }, { "value": 256, "label": "Smoke alarm" }, { "value": 512, "label": "CO Alarm" }, { "value": 1024, "label": "CO2 Alarm" }, { "value": 2048, "label": "Heat Alarm" }, { "value": 4096, "label": "Water Alarm" }, { "value": 8192, "label": "Access Control" }, { "value": 16384, "label": "Home Security" } ] }, { "id": 10, "label": "Release\/Disable alarm", "description": "Sets how you are able to disable Smart Switch 7s alarm state", "overview": "
        Value<\/strong><\/td> Description<\/strong><\/td> <\/tr>
        0<\/td> Tap 3 times to disable the alarm state.<\/td> <\/tr>
        1<\/td> Notification idle events.<\/td> <\/tr>
        10 - 255<\/td> Sets time in minutes on how long the alarm state should be held.<\/td> <\/tr><\/table>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] }, { "id": 18, "label": "Flash frequency", "description": "Configures the LED flash frequency and amount of time", "overview": "
        Byte Value<\/strong><\/td> Description<\/strong><\/td> <\/tr>
        (MSB Value 1)
        1 - 9<\/td>         		Sets the flash frequency in seconds. (Default = 0x0002 or 2)<\/td> <\/tr><\/table>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 2, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] }, { "id": 19, "label": "Start\/Stop LED flash", "description": "Sets the timeframe of flashing in seconds", "overview": "", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": true, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] }, { "id": 20, "label": "Power restored state", "description": "Switches state after an power outage", "overview": "

        Sets which state Smart Switch 7 switches to when power is lost then restored (power outage)<\/p>

        Value<\/strong><\/p> <\/td>

        		Description<\/strong><\/td> <\/tr>
        0<\/td> Last known state. (restore state before power loss)<\/td> <\/tr>
        1<\/td> Power restored to ON.<\/td> <\/tr>
        2<\/td>

        Power restored to OFF.<\/p> <\/td> <\/tr><\/table>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 2, "options": [] }, { "id": 80, "label": "Status Update", "description": " Determine which reports are sent to your gateway", "overview": "

        Keeps the status of Smart Switch 7 in sync with your Z-Wave gateway. Determine which reports are sent to your gateway upon a state change (ie. If switch turns ON, then the switch will forward state update to Z-Wave gateway).<\/p>

        Size = 1 Byte<\/p>

        Default Setting = 2<\/p>
        Value<\/strong><\/td> Description<\/strong><\/td> <\/tr>
        0<\/td> No report sent.<\/td> <\/tr>
        1<\/td> Report Basic Report.<\/td> <\/tr>
        2<\/td> Report Binary Switch.<\/td> <\/tr><\/table>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 2, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 2, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": "No report sent" }, { "value": 1, "label": "Report Basic Report" }, { "value": 2, "label": "Report Binary Switch" } ] }, { "id": 81, "label": "LED indicator mode", "description": "Allows you to configure how the LED indicator works", "overview": "
        Value<\/td> Description<\/td> <\/tr>
        0<\/td> LED Disabled.<\/td> <\/tr>
        1<\/td> Night Light Mode.
        • Use Parameter 82 to configure Night Light timing.<\/li>
        • Brightness can be controlled via Multilevel Switch CC.<\/li>
        • Colour can be controlled via Color Switch CC.<\/li> <\/ul><\/td> <\/tr>
        2<\/td> On\/Off Mode.
        • Default use
          • ON = 50% white light<\/li>
          • OFF = 10% green light<\/li> <\/ul><\/li>
          • Brightness can be controlled via Multilevel Switch CC.<\/li>
          • Colour can be controlled via Color Switch CC.<\/li> <\/ul><\/td> <\/tr><\/table>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 2, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 2, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": "LED Disabled" }, { "value": 1, "label": "Night Light Mode" }, { "value": 2, "label": "On\/Off Mode" } ] }, { "id": 82, "label": "Night Light Mode", "description": "Enable or disable Night Light Mode during specific times", "overview": "
            Value 1<\/td> ON Hour (0 - 23)<\/td> <\/tr>
            Value 2<\/td> ON Minute (0 - 59)<\/td> <\/tr>
            Value 3<\/td> OFF Hour (0 - 23)<\/td> <\/tr>
            Value 4<\/td> OFF Minute (0 - 59)<\/td> <\/tr><\/table>

            Byte value = 0x(Value 1)(Value 2)(Value 3)(Value 4)<\/strong><\/p>

            Suggestion - use a hexadecimal to decimal converter that can be easily found on google.<\/p>

            For example:<\/p>

            If you want to set Night Light Mode to be enabled at 19:00 at night and disable at 07:30 in the morning, you just need to configure:<\/p>

            Value1=0x13, Value2=0x00, Value3=0x07, Value4=0x1E.<\/p>

            Input 0x1300071E into a hexadecimal calculator, the output decimal value will be 318768926<\/p>", "size": 4, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 0, "options": [] }, { "id": 91, "label": "Watt threshold", "description": "When to send a watt report", "overview": "

            If Watt passes the threshold setting by + or -, a Watt\u00a0report will be sent to update its value.<\/p>
            Value<\/strong><\/td> Description<\/strong><\/td> <\/tr>
            0<\/td> Disable Watt threshold.<\/td> <\/tr>
            1 - 2300<\/td> Watt threshold setting.<\/td> <\/tr><\/table>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 2300, "options": [] }, { "id": 92, "label": "kWh threshold", "description": "When to send a kWh report", "overview": "

            If kWh passes the threshold setting by + or -, a kWh\u00a0report will be sent to update its value.<\/p>
            Value<\/strong><\/td> Description<\/strong><\/td> <\/tr>
            0<\/td> Disable kWh threshold.<\/td> <\/tr>
            1 - 10000<\/td> kWh threshold setting.<\/td> <\/tr><\/table>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 100, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 10000, "options": [] }, { "id": 93, "label": "Current threshold", "description": "When to send a current report", "overview": "

            If current passes the threshold setting by + or -, a current report will be sent to update its value.<\/p>
            Value<\/strong><\/td> Description<\/strong><\/td> <\/tr>
            0<\/td> Disable Current threshold.<\/td> <\/tr>
            1 - 100<\/td> Current threshold setting by scale of 0.1A<\/td> <\/tr><\/table>

            If value 10 is set, this is the equivalent of setting threshold to 1.0A.<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 100, "options": [] }, { "id": 101, "label": "Timed report enable\/disable", "description": "Configure timed report", "overview": "

            Sets what sensors should be reported at a timed interval. This can be used at the same time as threshold reporting to allow both thresholds and timed reports to be used.<\/p>
            Value<\/strong><\/td> Description<\/strong><\/td> <\/tr>
            1<\/td> kWh (Accumulated Power)<\/td> <\/tr>
            2<\/td> Watt (Power used at the time of the report)<\/td> <\/tr>
            4<\/td> Current<\/td> <\/tr>
            8<\/td> Voltage<\/td> <\/tr><\/table>

            The values in the table above should be added together.\u00a0<\/p>

            For example:<\/p>

            If you want kWh and Watt only, you would add 1 + 2 = 3.

            If you want all values (current, voltage, watt, kWh) reported at an interval, you would add 1 + 2 + 4 + 8 = 15.<\/p>

            If 0 is set to this parameter setting, this would completely disable timed reports. (Parameter 111 does not need to be set).<\/p>", "size": 4, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 15, "options": [] }, { "id": 111, "label": "Timed report interval", "description": "Reports the sensors set on Parameter 101", "overview": "

            Reports the sensors set on Parameter 101.<\/p>

            Size = 4 Byte<\/p>

            Default Setting = 600<\/p>
            Value<\/strong><\/td> Description<\/strong><\/td> <\/tr>
            30 - 2592000<\/td> Interval set in seconds.<\/td> <\/tr><\/table>", "size": 4, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 600, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 30, "value_max": 2592000, "options": [] }, { "id": 255, "label": "Factory reset", "description": "Factory reset the smart switch 7", "overview": "

            This value can only be configured to reset default values of Smart Switch 7 parameter settings. This can also be used to factory reset and remove it from your Z-Wave network.<\/p>
            Value<\/strong><\/td> Description<\/strong><\/td> <\/tr>
            0<\/td> Do nothing.<\/td> <\/tr>
            Any value within 4 bytes.<\/td> Reset Parameter Settings to default settings.<\/td> <\/tr>
            0x55555555 or 1431655765<\/td> Completely factory reset and remove from network.<\/td> <\/tr><\/table>", "size": 4, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 0, "options": [] } ], "associations": [ { "id": 1, "label": "Group 1", "max_nodes": 5, "controller": true, "description": "load notification type (lifeline)", "overview": "" } ] }
category_description: Small devices to be plugged into a power socket in a wall which stick there

parameters.label: Overload threshold
parameters.overview: If power exceeds the value set in this parameter for over 1 minute, Smart Switch 7 will report and overload report and turn off Smart Switch 7.

parameters.label: Switch reaction to alarm
parameters.description: What do to when an alarm is recieved
parameters.overview: Set the response of the switch in response to an operation performed when an alarm is received.

options.label: Turn the switch on and off
options.overview: Turn the switch on for 5 seconds, then off for 5 seconds until the alarm is disabled

parameters.label: Alarm reaction when received
parameters.description: Configure what alarms Smart Switch 7 will react to from other Z-Wave devices.
parameters.overview:
Value Description
0 The alarm will be triggered by open state, and be disabled by closed state.
1 The alarm will be triggered by closed state, and be disabled by open state.
256 Smoke alarm.
512 CO Alarm
1024 CO2 Alarm
2048 Heat Alarm
4096 Water Alarm
8192 Access Control
16384 Home Security

Value 0 and 1 cannot be used at the same time, choose one as a part of your calculation.

Use the sum of values to determine what alarms trigger your Smart Switch 7.

For example:

Value = 0 + 256 + 512 + 1024 = 1792
0 = sets the control scheme to turn on Smart Switch 7 when open alarm state happens

256 = allows Smoke Alarm signals to control SS7

512 = allows CO Alarm signals to control SS7

1024 = allows CO2 Alarm signals to control SS7

options.label: Trigger open, disabled closed
options.overview: The alarm will be triggered by open state, and be disabled by closed state.

options.label: Trigger closed, disabled open
options.overview: The alarm will be triggered by closed state, and be disabled by open state.

parameters.label: Release/Disable alarm
parameters.description: Sets how you are able to disable Smart Switch 7s alarm state
parameters.overview:
Value Description
0 Tap 3 times to disable the alarm state.
1 Notification idle events.
10 - 255 Sets time in minutes on how long the alarm state should be held.

parameters.label: Flash frequency
parameters.description: Configures the LED flash frequency and amount of time
parameters.overview:
Byte Value Description
(MSB Value 1)
1 - 9		 Sets the flash frequency in seconds. (Default = 0x0002 or 2)

parameters.label: Start/Stop LED flash
parameters.description: Sets the timeframe of flashing in seconds

parameters.label: Power restored state
parameters.description: Switches state after an power outage
parameters.overview:
Sets which state Smart Switch 7 switches to when power is lost then restored (power outage)

Value

 Description
0 Last known state. (restore state before power loss)
1 Power restored to ON.
2

Power restored to OFF.

parameters.label: Status Update
parameters.description: Determine which reports are sent to your gateway
parameters.overview:
Keeps the status of Smart Switch 7 in sync with your Z-Wave gateway. Determine which reports are sent to your gateway upon a state change (ie. If switch turns ON, then the switch will forward state update to Z-Wave gateway).

Size = 1 Byte

Default Setting = 2

Value Description
0 No report sent.
1 Report Basic Report.
2 Report Binary Switch.

parameters.label: LED indicator mode
parameters.description: Allows you to configure how the LED indicator works
parameters.overview:
Value Description
0 LED Disabled.
1 Night Light Mode.
  • Use Parameter 82 to configure Night Light timing.
  • Brightness can be controlled via Multilevel Switch CC.
  • Colour can be controlled via Color Switch CC.
2 On/Off Mode.
  • Default use
    • ON = 50% white light
    • OFF = 10% green light
  • Brightness can be controlled via Multilevel Switch CC.
  • Colour can be controlled via Color Switch CC.

options.label: Night Light Mode
options.overview:
• Use Parameter 82 to configure Night Light timing.
  • Brightness can be controlled via Multilevel Switch CC.
  • Colour can be controlled via Color Switch CC.

options.label: On/Off Mode
options.overview:
• Default use
    • ON = 50% white light
    • OFF = 10% green light
  • Brightness can be controlled via Multilevel Switch CC.
  • Colour can be controlled via Color Switch CC.

parameters.label: Night Light Mode
parameters.description: Enable or disable Night Light Mode during specific times
parameters.overview:
Value 1 ON Hour (0 - 23)
Value 2 ON Minute (0 - 59)
Value 3 OFF Hour (0 - 23)
Value 4 OFF Minute (0 - 59)

Byte value = 0x(Value 1)(Value 2)(Value 3)(Value 4)

Suggestion - use a hexadecimal to decimal converter that can be easily found on google.

For example:

If you want to set Night Light Mode to be enabled at 19:00 at night and disable at 07:30 in the morning, you just need to configure:

Value1=0x13, Value2=0x00, Value3=0x07, Value4=0x1E.

Input 0x1300071E into a hexadecimal calculator, the output decimal value will be 318768926

parameters.label: Watt threshold
parameters.description: When to send a watt report
parameters.overview:
If Watt passes the threshold setting by + or -, a Watt report will be sent to update its value.

Value Description
0 Disable Watt threshold.
1 - 2300 Watt threshold setting.

parameters.label: kWh threshold
parameters.description: When to send a kWh report
parameters.overview:
If kWh passes the threshold setting by + or -, a kWh report will be sent to update its value.

Value Description
0 Disable kWh threshold.
1 - 10000 kWh threshold setting.

parameters.label: Current threshold
parameters.description: When to send a current report
parameters.overview:
If current passes the threshold setting by + or -, a current report will be sent to update its value.

Value Description
0 Disable Current threshold.
1 - 100 Current threshold setting by scale of 0.1A

If value 10 is set, this is the equivalent of setting threshold to 1.0A.

parameters.label: Timed report enable/disable
parameters.overview:
Sets what sensors should be reported at a timed interval. This can be used at the same time as threshold reporting to allow both thresholds and timed reports to be used.

Value Description
1 kWh (Accumulated Power)
2 Watt (Power used at the time of the report)
4 Current
8 Voltage

The values in the table above should be added together. 

For example:

If you want kWh and Watt only, you would add 1 + 2 = 3.

If you want all values (current, voltage, watt, kWh) reported at an interval, you would add 1 + 2 + 4 + 8 = 15.

If 0 is set to this parameter setting, this would completely disable timed reports. (Parameter 111 does not need to be set).

parameters.label: Timed report interval
parameters.description: Reports the sensors set on Parameter 101
parameters.overview:
Reports the sensors set on Parameter 101.

Size = 4 Byte

Default Setting = 600

Value Description
30 - 2592000 Interval set in seconds.

parameters.label: Factory reset
parameters.overview:
This value can only be configured to reset default values of Smart Switch 7 parameter settings. This can also be used to factory reset and remove it from your Z-Wave network.

Value Description
0 Do nothing.
Any value within 4 bytes. Reset Parameter Settings to default settings.
0x55555555 or 1431655765 Completely factory reset and remove from network.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.

warnings: Endpoint 0 contains both switch and dimmer channels. It probably should only include dimmer!
